annotations.description: We have seen a great game today, let's hope the players will be able to maintain these high levels of play in order to keep fans entertained in future games. You have to say that the visitors have been the better side. The home team attempted to leave the opposition defence outnumbered and hit them on the break. The visitors tried to keep the ball on the ground and play a passing game.

annotations.label: corner

Marcelo (Real Madrid) produces a quality cross into the box, but the opposition's defence intercepts the ball and spanks it away. Real Madrid have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: Toni Kroos (Real Madrid) takes the corner, but one of the defenders reacts well and rises highest to head the ball away.

Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) latches on to a precise cross on the edge of the box and strikes the ball goalwards. However, it whistles wide of the left post so the goalkeeper can relax.

Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes narrowly over the bar. Terrific solo effort, though.

Good team movement sets up Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
Deyverson (Alaves) picks up a pass and hits the ball towards the bottom right corner, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Keylor Navas.
Mateo Kovacic (Real Madrid) covers his face with his hands after wasting a promising chance. He takes the rebound on the edge of the box but blazes the ball high over the crossbar.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Referee Jose Sanchez blows his whistle to start the second half.

Well, a decent first half here. It's certainly not boring, but not the best match either. The visitors enjoy superiority over the opposition. The home players attempt to beat the opposition's defence using mostly counter attacks. The away team tries to prevail using combination football.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Jose Sanchez has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.

Daniel Torres (Alaves) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Jose Sanchez no option but to blow his whistle.
